# f5distributedcloud_service_policy (Resource)

The `f5distributedcloud_service_policy` resource manages Service Policies in F5 Distributed Cloud.

Service Policies define traffic control rules for service-to-service communication.
They can be used to implement security policies, traffic routing, and access control.

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "f5distributedcloud_service_policy" "example" {
  name        = "my-service-policy"
  namespace   = "my-namespace"
  description = "Example service policy"

  default_action = "deny"

  rules {
    name   = "allow-internal"
    action = "allow"
  }
}
```

## Import

Service Policies can be imported using namespace/name:

```shell
terraform import f5distributedcloud_service_policy.example my-namespace/my-service-policy
```



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the Service Policy.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace where the Service Policy is created.

### Optional

- `default_action` (String) Default action when no rules match: 'allow' or 'deny'.
- `description` (String) Description of the Service Policy.
- `rules` (Block List) List of policy rules. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--rules))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the Service Policy.

<a id="nestedblock--rules"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rules`

Required:

- `action` (String) Action for the rule: 'allow' or 'deny'.
- `name` (String) Name of the rule.

Optional:

- `match_destinations` (Block List) Destination matching criteria. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--rules--match_destinations))
- `match_sources` (Block List) Source matching criteria. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--rules--match_sources))

<a id="nestedblock--rules--match_destinations"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rules.match_destinations`

Optional:

- `port` (Number) Port to match.
- `prefix` (String) IP prefix to match (CIDR notation).
- `protocol` (String) Protocol to match: 'tcp', 'udp', 'icmp'.


<a id="nestedblock--rules--match_sources"></a>
### Nested Schema for `rules.match_sources`

Optional:

- `asn` (Number) ASN to match.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace to match.
- `prefix` (String) IP prefix to match (CIDR notation).
- `prefix_list` (String) Reference to a prefix list.
